attributes.description: This section provides visualizations to help you assess compliance with CCI-003874, focusing on monitoring system software and service changes. This visualization displays the health status of software and service change monitoring based on anomaly scores from the associated ML job. To perform a component-level compliance assessment, utilize the global filters at the top of the Kibana dashboard. Apply filters like 'host.name: <your_component_name>' or 'package.name: <package_name>' to focus on specific systems or software. Observe the trends and individual anomaly events. A high anomaly score indicates a significant deviation from the established baseline, which could signify unauthorized software installations, service disruptions, or configuration changes, all of which warrant immediate investigation.
attributes.title: [CA-7, CCI-003874] Software & Service Changes Monitoring ML

attributes.description:
**Why and When:** This table provides a comprehensive, point-in-time inventory of all detected software packages and their versions.
It is the foundation for establishing an authorized software baseline.
Use it to verify that only approved software is present and to identify outdated or unauthorized packages during a compliance review.

**How:** Filter by `host.name` to audit a specific system.
Sort by `package.name` to group similar software. Compare the list against your organization's authorized software list.
A single instance of an unauthorized package is a clear finding that needs to be investigated to understand its security impact.
attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-003874] System Software Inventory

attributes.description:
**Why this visualization works:** This visualization displays the maximum anomaly score over time for the job monitoring software and service changes. It is particularly useful for detecting deviations from normal patterns of software installations, updates, removals, and service state changes, which could indicate unauthorized activity, misconfigurations, or system instability impacting compliance. 

**How an analyst can use it:** Look for spikes in the anomaly score. A high score indicates an unusual number of changes. Use the time selector to pinpoint these periods and investigate the specific `host.name`, `package.name`, `service.name`, `event.action`, and `event.type` associated with the anomaly. This helps determine if changes were authorized and if compliance is being maintained.
attributes.title: [CA-7, CCI-003874] ML - Software & Service Changes Anomaly Trend

attributes.description:
**Why and When:** This table lists the services running on your systems and their current state.
It is a key part of configuration management, helping to ensure that only authorized services are active.
Use this during audits to verify that system configurations align with security policies and authorized baselines.

**How:** Filter by `host.name` to focus on a single component.
Look for services that are unexpected or not part of your standard build (e.g., `service.state: running` for a service that should be disabled).
Investigate services with unusual names or those that shouldn't be running on a particular asset to determine any potential security impact.
attributes.title: [CA-7 / CCI-003874] System Service Inventory
